page.title: 04FOREST OF DEAN CONSERVATION
page.content: { VOLUNTEERS FORMED THE GLOUCESTERSHIRE TRUST FOR NATURE CONSERVATION BECAUSE CHANGES IN FARMING,FORESTRY & INDUSTRY ARE UPSETTING THE BALANCE OF NATURE. THE G.T.N.C. RENT 19 NATURE RESERVES & 17 PATCHES FROM THE FORESTRY COMM. FOR Â£10 FOR 14 YEARS. KNOWLEDGE GAINED IS SHARED. AT CANNOP RESERVE THEY GROW TREES LIKE OAK & BEECH, CLEAR BLOCKED STREAMS, CHECK THE UNDERGROWTH & HAVE BUILT A SILTTRAP ACROSS CANNOP POND.THEY LEAVE FALLEN TREES TO ENCOURAGE MANY TYPES OF WILDLIFE.SMALL SITES MARKED BY BLUE TOPPED POSTS PROTECT RARE SPECIES SUCH AS THE WOOD HORSETAIL FOUND WEST OF CANNOP PONDS. THEY ALSO MONITOR THE RETURN & CHANGES IN PLANTS & WILDLIFE AT THE RESTORED WOORGREEN OPEN CAST MINING SITE.
